attributes.action: BBC stop threats of prosecution when people legally cancel their TV Licence.
attributes.additional_details: Currently the BBC can demand entry into people’s homes with no evidence of wrongdoing when the person has exercised their right to make a choice of what they want to purchase and view.
attributes.background: Stop the BBC continually demanding people buy a TV Licence after they have legally cancelled their Licence because of the current conditions of people watching Streamed TV. And also people’s lack of faith in the BBC.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which call for a similar action:

Decriminalise BBC tv licence evasion: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549628

You may wish to know that visiting officers do not have any legal powers to enter your home without a search warrant granted by a magistrate. You can find out more here: https://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/about/foi-administering-the-licence-fee-AB20
